para.dtcname: Transmitter ID1 not Received (Test Mode DTC)
Transmitter ID2 not Received (Test Mode DTC)
Transmitter ID3 not Received (Test Mode DTC)
Transmitter ID4 not Received (Test Mode DTC)
Transmitter ID5 not Received (Test Mode DTC)

content5.ptxt: The tire pressure warning valve and transmitters that are installed in the tire and wheel assemblies measure the tire pressures. The measured values are transmitted to the tire pressure warning ECU and receiver in the vehicle as radio waves. The ECU compares the measured air pressure values with the air pressure threshold. When the measured air pressure value is less than this threshold, the warning light in the combination meter assembly illuminates.
The tire pressure warning valve and transmitters constantly send radio waves to the tire pressure warning ECU and receiver.
Under the conditions below, the tire pressure warning ECU and receiver is unable to receive the signals from the tire pressure warning valve and transmitters, and a DTC is stored.

item.ptxt: Facilities or devices that use similar radio frequencies are located in the vicinity of the vehicle.
Devices using similar radio frequencies are used in the vehicle.
The ID of a tire pressure warning valve and transmitter is mistyped during registration.
A tire, wheel and/or transmitter from a different vehicle is installed.

atten4.ptxt: When no transmitter ID is received from a tire pressure warning valve and transmitter for a total of 10 minutes while the vehicle speed is more than 40 km/h (25 mph), or no transmitter ID is received from all the tire pressure warning valve and transmitters for a total of 10 minutes, these DTCs are stored.

DTCs from C2121/21 to C2125/25 can only be cleared by using the GTS. DTCs from C2181/81 to C2185/85 can be cleared when the tire pressure warning valve and transmitter sends a forced transmission signal or test mode ends. DTCs from C2181/81 to C2185/85 are output only in test mode.

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: (a) When all conditions below are met:

item.ptxt: Tire pressure warning valve and transmitter is not in stop mode.
Any transmitter ID is not received from tire pressure warning valve and transmitters.
Vehicle speed is more than 40 km/h (25 mph) or no vehicle speed signal is received for 10 minutes or more.

data-name.ptxt: (b) When both conditions below are met:

item.ptxt: Tire pressure warning valve and transmitter is not in stop mode.
No transmitter ID is received from tire pressure warning valve and transmitters for 10 minutes or more.
Tire pressure warning valve and transmitter
Tire pressure warning ECU and receiver

data-name.ptxt: (a) When all conditions below are met:

data-name.ptxt: (b) When both conditions below are met:

item.ptxt: Tire pressure warning valve and transmitter is not in stop mode.
No transmitter ID is received from tire pressure warning valve and transmitters for 10 minutes or more.
Tire pressure warning valve and transmitter
Tire pressure warning ECU and receiver

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Transmitter ID1 not Received (Test Mode DTC)

item.ptxt: Tire pressure warning valve and transmitter
Tire pressure warning ECU and receiver

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Transmitter ID2 not Received (Test Mode DTC)

item.ptxt: Tire pressure warning valve and transmitter
Tire pressure warning ECU and receiver

item.ptxt: Tire pressure warning valve and transmitter

data-name.name: detect-item

item.ptxt: Tire pressure warning valve and transmitter
Tire pressure warning ECU and receiver

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Transmitter ID5 not Received (Test Mode DTC)

item.ptxt: Tire pressure warning valve and transmitter
Tire pressure warning ECU and receiver
(Main) is displayed on the DTC screen for the DTCs even when the 2nd set of tires is selected.
When DTC C2174/74 is output together with DTC C2121/21, C2122/22, C2123/23, C2124/24 and/or C2125/25, inspect and repair the trouble areas indicated by DTC C2174/74 first.

atten4.ptxt: It is necessary to perform the following procedure to identify the tire pressure warning valve and transmitter that is malfunctioning because it cannot be identified by the output DTC.

item.ptxt: When replacing the tire pressure warning ECU and receiver, read the transmitter IDs stored in the old ECU using the GTS and write them down before removal.

It is necessary to perform initialization after registration of the transmitter IDs into the tire pressure warning ECU and receiver if the ECU and/or one of the valve and transmitters has been replaced.

test1.ptxt: Check that the vehicle is not located in an area such as described below:

test2.ptxt: Facilities or devices that use similar radio frequencies are located in the vicinity of the vehicle.

atten4.ptxt: If the vehicle is located in an area such as the one described above, the tire pressure warning light may come on only in a particular area.

test2.ptxt: Devices using similar radio frequencies are used in the vehicle.

specitem.ptxt: Facilities or devices that use similar radio frequencies are not located in the vicinity of the vehicle.

atten4.ptxt: Radio transmissions may be interrupted due to the surroundings or devices installed by the user.

action.actiontitle: CHECK IF ANY DEVICE IS INSTALLED BY USER

test1.ptxt: Set the tire pressure to the specified values.
Click here
Turn the ignition switch off.
Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Chassis / Tire Pressure Monitor / Data List.
Display the "ID Tire Inflation Pressure" value for each wheel using the GTS.

Rapidly reduce the tire pressure for each wheel at least 40 kPa (0.4 kg/cm2, 5.8 psi) within 30 seconds. If the "ID Tire Inflation Pressure" value displayed on the GTS does not change, the tire pressure warning valve and transmitter corresponding to the unchanged "ID Tire Inflation Pressure" value was the cause of the output DTC.

item.ptxt: Identify the malfunctioning tire pressure warning valve and transmitter by repeatedly decreasing the tire pressure for each tire.
Record which "ID Tire Inflation Pressure" value corresponds to each tire.

gts-info.title: Chassis > Tire Pressure Monitor > Data List

data-name.name: range
data-name.ptxt: min.: Absolute pressure (abs) / 0 kPa (0 kgf/cm2, 0 psi), Relative pressure (gauge) / 0 kPa (0 kgf/cm2, 0 psi)
max.: Absolute pressure (abs) / 480 kPa (4.9 kgf/cm2, 70 psi), Relative pressure (Gauge) / 380 kPa (3.9 kgf/cm2, 55 psi)

test1.ptxt: for Short Body with Tire Size 265/70R16:

gts-info.title: Chassis > Tire Pressure Monitor > Data List

test1.ptxt: except Short Body with Tire Size 265/70R16:

gts-info.title: Chassis > Tire Pressure Monitor > Data List

test1.ptxt: Check the Data List.

item.ptxt: It may take a few minutes to display the updated tire pressure data.

When the "ID Tire Inflation Pressure" data has not changed, reset the tire pressure to the appropriate specified value and rotate the tire 90 to 270 degrees. Then rapidly release the tire pressure and recheck the data.
Record the transmitter ID of which "ID Tire Inflation Pressure" data corresponds to each tire.

test1.ptxt: After confirming that the "ID Tire Inflation Pressure" value for one tire has changed, repeat this procedure for each tire. Identify the transmitter that corresponds to the DTC.

entry.ptxt: One or more transmitters are abnormal

test1.ptxt: Turn the ignition switch off.
Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Chassis / Tire Pressure Monitor / Data List.
Check the values by referring to the table below.

gts-info.title: Chassis > Tire Pressure Monitor > Data List

data-name.name: standard-value
data-name.ptxt: ID No. registered for transmitter ID1 displayed

data-name.name: standard-value
data-name.ptxt: ID No. registered for transmitter ID2 displayed

data-name.name: standard-value
data-name.ptxt: ID No. registered for transmitter ID3 displayed

data-name.name: standard-value
data-name.ptxt: ID No. registered for transmitter ID4 displayed

data-name.name: standard-value
data-name.ptxt: ID No. registered for transmitter ID5 displayed

item.ptxt: *: Displayed only when the ID No. is not registered.
The wheel position cannot be determined from ID1 through ID5 on the Data List.

gts-info.title: Chassis > Tire Pressure Monitor > Data List

test1.ptxt: Check the ID number on the identified transmitter by removing it from the tire and wheel.

atten3.ptxt: Use a tire pressure warning valve and transmitter with a part number that matches that of the vehicle.

test2.ptxt: for Short Body with Tire Size 265/70R16:

entry.ptxt: Tire Pressure Warning Valve and Transmitter

atten3.ptxt: Make sure to use a tire pressure warning valve and transmitter that has an identification mark but no white cover. Otherwise, ID registration cannot be performed.

test2.ptxt: except Short Body with Tire Size 265/70R16:

entry.ptxt: Tire Pressure Warning Valve and Transmitter

atten3.ptxt: Make sure to use a tire pressure warning valve and transmitter that has a white cover. Otherwise, ID registration cannot be performed.

test1.ptxt: Confirm that the ID number on the transmitter and the recorded transmitter ID match.

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE TIRE PRESSURE WARNING VALVE AND TRANSMITTER
